alert.note: Alert for Fairfield; Hocking (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 06 at 1:28PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SOUTHEASTERN FAIRFIELD AND HOCKING COUNTIES THROUGH 200 PM EDT... At 128 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located near Logan, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 45 mph, half inch hail, and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Visibility will be poor and hydroplaning is possible. Locations impacted include... Logan, Nelsonville, Hocking Hills State Park, Hide-A-Way Hills, Starr, Murray City, Sugar Grove, Gibisonville, Ilesboro, Hideaway Hills, Haydenville, Lake Logan State Park, South Bloomingville, Enterprise, Union Furnace, Rockbridge, Oreville and Carbon Hill. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Motorists should slow down and use extra caution. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 700 PM EDT for central Ohio. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
